title: 107_hr2787
content:
SECTION 1. REFERENCE. This Act amends sections of the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990. SEC. 2. FINDINGS AND PURPOSE. Congress makes findings related to mothers in the workforce, children with disabilities, early intervention services, and special education preschool services under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act. The General Accounting Office also reports on the supply of infant care and care for special needs children. The Act aims to increase quality child care for children with disabilities, as there is limited care available for them, especially in low-income communities. Children with disabilities are often excluded from child care programs due to misconceptions and lack of staff training. The Act aims to improve child care quality for children with disabilities by expanding services to families with children who have disabilities. Section 658G (42 U.S.C. 9858e) is amended to require states to use at least 5 percent of funds for activities to increase quality child care for children with disabilities. The amendment to Section 658G requires states to allocate 5% of funds for activities supporting quality child care for children with disabilities, including training and technical assistance for child care providers and parents on ADA and IDEA implementation. The amendment to Section 658G mandates states to allocate 5% of funds for activities supporting quality child care for children with disabilities. This includes training child care directors and staff on assistive technology, developing leadership skills for inclusive child care programs, and providing assistance to State and local child care facilities. The amendment mandates states to allocate funds for quality child care for children with disabilities, including training staff on compliance with disability laws, recruitment, and retention of qualified staff through scholarships and salary increases. The Secretary shall provide grants and low-interest loans for projects that increase availability of inclusive child care programs, child care for infants, and child care during evenings and weekends. SEC. 5. REPORTS.

Amendment to Section 658K(a)(1)(B)(iii) (42 U.S.C. 9858i(a)(1)(B)(iii)) to include disability status.

SEC. 6. DEFINITIONS. SEC. 6. DEFINITIONS. Amends Section 658P to define "child with a disability" and "inclusive child care program."
